sect1.title: What are Desktop Effects?
sect1.para: Ubuntu now includes the option to activate special desktop effects, which can make your desktop more fun and easier to use. These include:

Desktop effects are optional, and it is not necessary to have them turned on. In addition, users of computers with certain graphics cards may find that desktop effects do not work well on their computer, or cause the computer to operate more slowly than it would with the effects turned off.

sect1.title: Activating Desktop Effects
sect1.para: To activate desktop effects, open &desktop-effects; and click Enable Desktop Effects. Your screen may flicker briefly while the effects are being enabled. You will then be asked if you would like to keep the new settings.

listitem.para: If the desktop effects have been turned on correctly, press Keep settings.

If the desktop effects do not appear to be working properly (for example, if you cannot see the desktop or your screen looks strange), press Use previous settings to turn-off desktop effects. Alternatively, wait for 40 seconds without pressing any keys. After this period, desktop effects will be turned off automatically and your screen should return to normal.

sect1.title: Configuring Desktop Effects
sect1.para: Press &desktop-effects; to change basic options relating to desktop effects.

listitem.para: Tick Windows Wobble when Moved if you would like windows to wobble when you drag them around the screen.
Tick Workspaces on a Cube if you would like to see a spinning cube effect when you change workspaces.

sect2.title: Advanced configuration
sect2.para: Further configuration of desktop effects is possible, although less straightforward.

listitem.para: Press AltF2, type gconf-editor and then press Run to start the Configuration Editor.
Navigate to /apps/compiz and change the relevant settings.

sect2.para: It is possible to change many settings relating to desktop effects using the Configuration Editor. See the Compiz documentation website for full instructions on how to do this.

listitem.para: See the Ubuntu Community Support pages for more information on desktop effects in Ubuntu.
See the Compiz documentation website for more information on advanced configuration of desktop effects.
